messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Float
        Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Float
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [R_TEMP]
    Report Mode [R_MODE]
    Report Fan Speed [R_FAN]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius and switch it to heat mode with medium fan speed?

First, I review the device structure to identify the commands and parameters needed. The thermostat accepts Set Temperature with a float parameter between 10.0 and 30.0 °C, Set Mode with enum values Off, Heat, Cool, Auto, and Set Fan Speed with enum values Low, Medium, High.

The user wants to set the temperature to 22 °C, mode to Heat, and fan speed to Medium.

Step 1: Use Set Temperature command with parameter 22.0 °C.
Step 2: Use Set Mode command with parameter Heat (enum value 1).
Step 3: Use Set Fan Speed command with parameter Medium (enum value 1).

Result: Execute SET_TEMP(22.0), SET_MODE(Heat), and SET_FAN(Medium) to fulfill the request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light Panel
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [100]
    Brightness
      Integer
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Integer
        Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]
    Set Brightness [SBRT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Color Temperature [SCT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the light panel brightness to 75% and color temperature to 4000 Kelvin. How do I do that?

I first identify the relevant commands and parameters from the device structure. The device supports Set Brightness (SBRT) with a parameter from 0 to 100 percent and Set Color Temperature (SCT) with a parameter from 2700 to 6500 Kelvin.

The user wants brightness at 75% and color temperature at 4000 K, both within the allowed ranges.

Step 1: Use Set Brightness command with parameter 75%.
Step 2: Use Set Color Temperature command with parameter 4000 K.

Result: Send SBRT(75) to set brightness and SCT(4000) to set color temperature on the light panel.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power
      Float
        Range 0.0 to 5000.0 Unit W
    Total Energy
      Float
        Range 0.0 to 10000.0 Unit kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Active [1]
        Inactive [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy [RESET]
    Query Power [Q_PWR]
    Query Energy [Q_ENG]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power [R_PWR]
    Report Energy [R_ENG]

USER QUERY:
How can I check the current power consumption and reset the total energy reading?

Reviewing the device structure, the NuCore Energy Meter has commands to query current power (Q_PWR) and total energy (Q_ENG), and a command to reset energy (RESET).

To check current power consumption, send the Query Power command (Q_PWR).
To reset the total energy reading, send the Reset Energy command (RESET).

Step 1: Execute Q_PWR to get current power in watts.
Step 2: Execute RESET to clear the total energy counter.

Result: Use Q_PWR to check current power and RESET to reset total energy on the energy meter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Fan Controller
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
    Timer
      Integer
        Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Speed [SET_SPD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Set Oscillation [SET_OSC]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Disabled [0]
          Enabled [1]
    Set Timer [SET_TMR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Speed [R_SPD]
    Report Oscillation [R_OSC]
    Report Timer [R_TMR]

USER QUERY:
Please turn the fan on high speed, enable oscillation, and set a timer for 45 minutes.

From the device structure, the fan speed can be set using Set Speed with enum values Off, Low, Medium, High. Oscillation can be enabled or disabled with Set Oscillation command. Timer is an integer from 0 to 120 minutes set via Set Timer.

User wants fan speed High (enum 3), oscillation Enabled (enum 1), and timer 45 minutes (within 0-120).

Step 1: Send Set Speed command with parameter High.
Step 2: Send Set Oscillation command with parameter Enabled.
Step 3: Send Set Timer command with parameter 45 minutes.

Result: Execute SET_SPD(High), SET_OSC(Enabled), and SET_TMR(45) to configure the fan as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Battery Level
      Integer
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock [LOCK]
    Unlock [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Lock Status [R_LOCK]
    Report Battery Level [R_BATT]

USER QUERY:
Is the door locked right now and what is the battery level?

The device properties include Lock Status (Locked or Unlocked) and Battery Level (0-100%). The device supports Query Status command to get current states and can send reports for lock status and battery level.

To determine if the door is locked, we need to query the lock status.
To find the battery level, we query the battery report.

Step 1: Send Query Status command to get current lock status and battery level.
Step 2: Interpret the Lock Status property: Locked means door is secured, Unlocked means open.
Step 3: Read Battery Level property to know remaining battery percentage.

Result: Query the device status to confirm if the door is locked and check battery level percentage.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Integer
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving Up [1]
        Moving Down [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Raise [RAISE]
    Lower [LOWER]
    Stop [STOP]
    Set Position [SET_POS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [R_POS]
    Report Status [R_STAT]

USER QUERY:
Can you lower the window shade to 40% and then stop it?

The device supports lowering the shade with the Lower command and setting a specific position with Set Position command (0-100%). It also supports Stop command to halt movement.

User wants to lower the shade to 40% position and then stop it.

Step 1: Use Set Position command with parameter 40% to move the shade to 40% lowered.
Step 2: After movement, send Stop command to halt any further motion.

Alternatively, Lower command initiates downward movement but does not specify position, so Set Position is more precise.

Result: Execute SET_POS(40) to lower the shade to 40%, then send STOP to stop movement.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Irrigation Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Float
        Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        True [1]
        False [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 8 Unit Zone Number
    Stop Zone [STOP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 8 Unit Zone Number
    Set Flow Rate [SET_FLOW]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Enable Schedule [EN_SCH]
    Disable Schedule [DIS_SCH]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [R_ZONE]
    Report Flow Rate [R_FLOW]
    Report Schedule Status [R_SCH]

USER QUERY:
Please start irrigation on zone 3 with a flow rate of 12 liters per minute and enable the schedule.

The device accepts Start Zone command with zone number 1-8, Set Flow Rate with 0.0 to 20.0 L/min, and Enable Schedule command.

User wants to start zone 3, set flow rate to 12 L/min, and enable schedule.

Step 1: Send Start Zone command with parameter 3.
Step 2: Send Set Flow Rate command with parameter 12.0 L/min.
Step 3: Send Enable Schedule command to activate scheduling.

Result: Execute START(3), SET_FLOW(12.0), and EN_SCH to fulfill the irrigation request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Filter Life
      Integer
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power On [P_ON]
    Power Off [P_OFF]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Status [R_PWR]
    Report Fan Speed [R_FAN]
    Report Filter Life [R_FLIFE]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the air purifier, set the fan speed to high, and tell me the remaining filter life.

The device supports Power On and Power Off commands, Set Fan Speed with enum Low, Medium, High, and can report filter life as a percentage.

User wants to turn on the purifier, set fan speed to High (enum 3), and get filter life.

Step 1: Send Power On command.
Step 2: Send Set Fan Speed command with parameter High.
Step 3: Query the device to get Filter Life property.

Result: Execute P_ON, SET_FAN(High), and then request R_FLIFE to obtain remaining filter life percentage.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Float
        Range 20.0 to 80.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Float
        Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heating [1]
        Ready [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Current Temperature [R_CUR_TEMP]
    Report Status [R_STAT]

USER QUERY:
Set the water heater target temperature to 60 degrees Celsius and turn it on.

The device accepts Set Target Temperature command with a float parameter between 30.0 and 75.0 °C and Turn On command.

User wants to set target temperature to 60 °C and turn the heater on.

Step 1: Use SET_TEMP command with parameter 60.0 °C.
Step 2: Use ON command to power on the water heater.

Result: Execute SET_TEMP(60.0) and ON to set the target temperature and turn on the water heater.
